file_content.text: So this is how it ends. A lifetime of service to the greatest cause in galactic history.
What happens now? A simple execution? Or will the last civilized man be paraded through the streets of Coruscant as a trophy for your ignorant masses?
General Rakton, consider yourself a prisoner of the Galactic Republic.
I'm taking you in alive.
Let your primitive mockery of justice begin.
Dragging you through the streets sounds pretty good.
I do love a parade.
Disgusting. Your people are beneath contempt.
Major! We've got serious heat incoming. The scanners are lit up like--whoa. Is that him?
The Empire's greatest general. We've beaten him.
Affirmative.
The Empire will still succeed in the end.
What's our time to engagement?
There's trouble coming?
Uh... not much. A few minutes, max.
What's going on, and why can't you people handle it?
Focus, Coria!
The Imps must have finally realized Rakton was off comms. They're sending a huge force our way--too many for us to handle.
I think it's time to pull out, sir. The Safecrackers can get Rakton out for you.
Be sure to get yourselves out safely, too.
Thanks, Lieutenant.
You got it, Major. Come on, Rakton--move out.
Rakton may be beaten, but he's still dangerous. Stay sharp.
Keep an eye on him.
Understood--he'll be under full guard at all times. Let's go, Rakton.
Until we meet again, Major.
We're in a hurry--no time for excess weight.
No need. [Kill Rakton]
Argh!
I... guess that answers that question.
We'd better get to our evac points--it's been an honor, Major. Take care.
Now, you die.
Execution. [Kill Rakton]
Argh!
We got him. It's finally over. Hard to believe.
General Rakton has finally been beaten. This will send shock waves through the entire Empire.
Even the Republic's greatest foe is no match for Havoc Squad. Let the free people of the galaxy rest secured!
That wasn't so bad. Wonder if there's any other top-flight generals in the Empire we could hit on the way home.
Yuun sees great portent in this act. The path of the galaxy changes by our hands--today, we are the shapers of destiny.
Major! Serious heat's coming in, the scanners are completely off the--whoa. Is that... was that him?
General Rakton has been neutralized.
Affirmative.
Wow. He's dead. This is going to change everything.
What kind of heat are we looking at, Lieutenant?
Is trouble coming?
Uh... can't get a definite fix. A lot. A whole lot.
Ignore the corpse and give me a sitrep, soldier!
Focus, Coria!
Somehow, the Imps have figured out that Rakton's off comms. They're sending everything they've got this way. It's too much to handle, sir.
With respect, I think we'd better bug out. Everyone has their evac points set--you just have to give the word, Major.
You're cleared to evacuate, Lieutenant. Make sure everyone gets the word.
Get everyone out of here.
Understood, sir. I'll let everyone know right away.
Don't leave anything behind for the Empire except corpses.
The Imps will be disappointed.
Understood, sir. We'll make it happen.
If none of you are willing to fight, I guess we'd better run.
I guess we have no choice.
Apologies if you're disappointed, sir. But with the job done... nobody sees any point in dying here.
It's been a real honor, Major. See you next time.
The one worthy opponent in the entire Republic. Ironically outmaneuvering all of my plans to save the Republic's people.
Can you not see your corrupt and weak-minded leaders are dragging you down?
Your Republic will fall--by the hands of the Empire or by the weight of its own decadence. The end is inevitable. Why prolong the suffering?
The Republic has stood for thousands of years--it won't fail now.
You're wrong.
You delude yourself. Like so many others, you willfully accept the lies of men weaker than you.
Is this how you greet everyone you meet?
Hello to you, too.
You think this is a joke?
You're nothing but a slave to a cult of insane tyrants.
Are you really so deluded?
I am ruled by those more powerful than myself--this is only logical. You are ruled by liars and thieves, whose only power is popularity.
The people of the Republic are crushed by bureaucracy, neither encouraged nor allowed to reach their fullest potential.
Under Imperial rule, your people will be free to excel, to take charge of their own fates. I will give your people the future they deserve.
The Empire doesn't free people--it conquers them.
You want a galaxy of slaves.
It is unfortunate that you will only partake in a civilized way of life when forced.
You want to conquer the galaxy for its own good?
What, you're a charity worker?
The people of the Republic are cowed and complacent, when they could be fully engaged in the great works of the Empire.
I didn't come here to listen to you ramble, Rakton.
Spare me the nonsense.
No. It was too much to expect you to see through your indoctrination and accept a better way of life.
With the intel I've collected here, I can wage a war so destructive that your Republic will fall in a matter of months.
So I offer this: Return to your masters. Convince them to surrender unconditionally. Avoid millions of deaths trying to prevent a victory that would free your people!
You won't be leading any more campaigns, Rakton. Give it up.
The war is over for you.
You're a fool--you can't stop me any more than the millions of others who have tried.
I have you, Rakton. You expect me to just leave now?
You must be joking.
You actually think you can beat me. Why does no one see sense, even after all this time?
I hope the image of your corpse will encourage your subordinates to see reason where you could not.
If you have any final words, now is the time.
For freedom!
If you really want to avoid violence, you'll give up now.
You can still surrender.
I will never abandon the Emperor's cause.
Putting you down is going to be a pleasure, General.
I'm going to enjoy this.
You should have brought more men.
Here's my counteroffer, Rakton.
No thanks. [Attack]
So be it!
